modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power) to save and the human 'Non-Pouvoir' (Inability) to save themselves or escape judgment, which paradoxically becomes liberation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'pretension of strength' (~S2) to the reality of 'judgment' (S2), then through the 'weakness' of the cross to 'mercy' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'radical leveling' where all are S2 (under judgment) so that all may receive S1 (mercy).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; judgment is described as inescapable and sin as a 'sickness unto death'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human condition as one of total inability and positions God as the primary actor who has 'already done' the work of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential for 'Be like the good neighbor'
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: may he open the hearts... to help our fellow servants

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God who is really God has really spoken to us

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (like the woman reading Psalm 6) are used as mirrors for the human condition of lack, not as models of moral performance.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Cecile Conway (as an icon of the 'Weak')
The Unforgiving Servant (as a mirror of the Hearer)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: N/A - The sermon already uses a theocentric reading.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Liberation through the admission of weakness.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification by grace alone, apart from human distinctions.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the primary program (God's mercy) to the secondary (our help) is perfectly integrated via the 'fellow servant' motif.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: what our Savior Jesus Christ has already done for every one of us

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'baptized mind' to see reality correctly.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative structure is robustly theocentric. God is the Subject of the primary action (speaking, pitying, saving), while the hearer is positioned as the Receiver.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon successfully avoids the Devoir (moralistic 'must') trap.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in the 'Grammar of Grace.' It relentlessly places God in the subject position and uses the human crisis of Katrina not as a moral lesson, but as a revelation of universal human need and divine mercy.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the emotional pathos of the Katrina stories, Greimassian analysis reveals that these stories serve to strip the 'Subject' (Hearer) of their 'Pouvoir' (Power), forcing a Subject-switch to God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegese might focus on the historical context of Romans 14; semiotics shows how Paul's 'strong/weak' logic is structurally applied to the contemporary 'liberal/poor' divide.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'shock' of the parable is a semiotic reversal where the Hearer is moved from the role of Judge (Sender) to the role of Debtor (Receiver).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Fleming Rutledge's own principles of 'God as Subject' with high consistency.
